link.synopsis: A one-night stand results in an unexpected pregnancy for entertainment reporter Alison (Katherine Heigl), who vows to be a good mom and keep her career on track by trying to make things work with the slacker (Seth Rogen) who knocked her up. It's anything but smooth sailing as the odd couple gets acquainted, but Alison finds there's more to her baby's daddy than she originally thought. Paul Rudd co-stars in this Judd Apatow romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Sex and the City: The Movie
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: When Rajiv's respectable uncle gives his blessing to his nephew's love for Sanjana, he doesn't know the girl comes from a Mafia family. When he tries to retract his approval, Sanjana's brothers set out on a comical mission to convince him otherwise. Directed by Anees Bazmee, this rollicking comedy stars Akshay Kumar, Katrina Kaif, Paresh Rawal, Nana Patekar, Anil Kapoor and Mallika Sherawat.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When a shot intended for her philandering boyfriend accidentally hits a judge in the behind, a tough-talking saloon singer (pinup girl Betty Grable) is forced to hide out in a new town, where she poses as the local schoolteacher. Cesar Romero (who later became famous as the gaping Joker on TV's "Batman") also stars in this Wild West musical comedy directed by Preston Sturges.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
title.short: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: When museum docent Chase Revere (Justin Long) and sexpot Lucy Shanks (Emmanuelle Chriqui) learn that their town's Revolutionary War battlefield is slated to be plowed under to make way for a casino, they launch a campaign to save the historic site. But as they take their fight to the voters, the unlikely duo runs into stiff resistance from a community eager to trade its heritage for easy cash in this sly comedy directed by Talmage Cooley.
link.title: synopsis
The Year of Getting to Know Us

link.synopsis: Trace the fascinating lives of New Zealand's provocative music and comedy duo Jools and Linda Topp through this enjoyable documentary, which details the lesbian twins' rural upbringing, political activism and immense popularity at home and abroad. Featuring hilarious interviews with several of the sisters' most outrageous alter egos, this joyous celebration also includes brilliant insights into New Zealand's history.
link.title: synopsis
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement
Phil Ochs: There But for Fortune
For the Bible Tells Me So
The Boys: The Sherman Brothers' Story
The Real Dirt on Farmer John
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
Harlan Ellison: Dreams with Sharp Teeth
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: In this musical-comedy caper, flamboyant con artist Tabrez Mirza Khan and his band of gleeful robbers have pulled off heists the world over, but they may be gambling with fate when smugglers hire them to swipe antiques from a speeding train.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After a supernatural romp with a satanic emo band, hot cheerleader Jennifer (Megan Fox) is transformed into a demon with an insatiable appetite for high school boys. Now, it's up to Jennifer's BFF, Needy (Amanda Seyfried), to protect the guys from the bloodthirsty man-eater. Penned by Diablo Cody (Juno), this one-of-a-kind horror comedy co-stars Adam Brody as the devil-worshipping band's lead singer.
link.title: synopsis
Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
A Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge
Friday the 13th: Part 4: The Final Chapter
Friday the 13th: Part 5: A New Beginning

link.synopsis: On the verge of bankruptcy, an aristocratic English couple rents their mansion to an American rock band -- and is forced to masquerade as the butler and the cook when the hired help fails to show up in this engaging comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Eddie and the Cruisers II: Eddie Lives

link.synopsis: When a fanatical U.S. general (Sterling Hayden) launches an air strike against the Soviets, they raise the stakes by threatening to unleash a "doomsday device," setting the stage for Armageddon in this classic black comedy that brilliantly skewers the nuclear age. The film's star-studded cast includes George C. Scott, Slim Pickens, James Earl Jones and Peter Sellers (who steals the show and copped an Oscar nod playing three roles).
link.title: synopsis
Stanley Kubrick: A Life in Pictures
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
The Day the Earth Stood Still
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different

link.synopsis: Georgia peaches Belle (Anna Faris) and Bell (Laura Breckenridge) long to break free of their small-town lives and head to the big city of Atlanta in this warmhearted comedy. But they face numerous obstacles, including Bell's rap-loving hayseed boyfriend. Just when they're getting close to scraping up enough money to make the move, another roadblock arises -- Bell falls for a handsome local cop named ... Rhett Butler (Justin Chambers).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Millionaire Robert Talbot arrives at his posh Italian villa for a vacation, but there are a few unwelcome surprises in store for him. The villa's manager has rented the place out as a hotel, and it's been overrun by a gaggle of American girls.
link.title: synopsis
Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Has Anybody Seen My Gal? / A Very Special Favor
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
A Guide for the Married Man
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: A mischievous ghost tries to stop his widow from marrying a stuffy bore in this supernatural comedy. Widowed three years, Kay (Sally Field) still misses her Broadway choreographer husband, Jolly (James Caan), but she's ready to start anew by marrying Dr. Rupert Baines (Jeff Bridges). But her plans don't go smoothly; a week before the wedding, Jolly's spirit dances onto the scene and wreaks havoc by taunting Kay for loving such a stiff shirt.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: In Whit Stillman's offbeat comedy, three pretty friends plan to use music, dance and perfume to brighten the lives of their fellow college students. But before long, the girls find themselves busy dealing with problems of their own.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: When Phil and Debbie Winslow (Lee Pace and Judy Greer) relocate from their native Kansas to the sunny climes of Orange County, their big-hearted, havoc-wreaking Great Dane (voiced by Owen Wilson) gets a taste of the dog's life, California-style. Featuring the voices of Emma Stone, George Lopez and Steve Coogan, this family comedy blends live action and computer  animation to bring the-beloved, if slobbery, comic-strip mutt to life.
link.title: synopsis
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel
Tom and Jerry Meet Sherlock Holmes
Free Willy 4: Escape from Pirate's Cove

link.synopsis: "He doesn't love every woman. Just yours." In this lighthearted romantic comedy, Hill Harper plays Theodorous Melville, a man who simply can't resist the charms of the diverse women, married and otherwise, he encounters in New York. The ladies in Melville's life include Samantha (Laurel Holloman), Frances (Nicole Parker), Mona (Sandrine Holt) and Phylicia Rashad as his disapproving mother, Alice.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Five on the Black Hand Side

link.synopsis: All hell breaks loose when a woman reveals a secret to her fiancé in comedian-director Bob Goldthwait's edgy romantic comedy. Encouraged by her mother and co-worker, Amy (Melinda Page Hamilton) tells her husband-to-be about a rather shocking past sexual encounter. But her confession threatens to destroy the relationship, and what unfolds is a story of integrity, family ties, bravery and forgiveness. Bryce Johnson and Colby French co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Mysteries of Angels and Demons

link.synopsis: Adapted from the novel La Femme et le Pantin by Pierre Louys, this Oscar-nominated erotic dark comedy was Luis Buñuel's final film. The story follows, in flashback, middle-aged Mathieu (Fernando Rey) and his obsession for the much younger, moody Conchita (played by both Carole Bouquet and Angela Molina). The two play a continuous tug-of-war with each other's desires, each trying to outlast the other at their own game.
link.title: synopsis
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Director Nick Broomfield chronicles Nirvana's Kurt Cobain, the grunge icon who died in 1994 at age 27. The film charts his rise to fame, his drug-addled relationship with Courtney Love and the conspiracy theories surrounding his death.
link.title: synopsis
Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
Aileen Wuornos: The Selling of a Serial Killer
Too Tough To Die: A Tribute To Johnny Ramone
The Flaming Lips: The Fearless Freaks
William S. Burroughs: A Man Within
Tupac Shakur: Thug Angel: The Life of an Outlaw
We Jam Econo: The Story of the Minutemen
Rising Son: The Legend of Skateboarder Christian Hosoi
Classic Albums: John Lennon: Plastic Ono Band
Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson
Amazing Journey: The Story of The Who
Private Practices: The Story of a Sex Surrogate
I Am Trying to Break Your Heart: A Film About Wilco
Joan Baez: How Sweet the Sound

link.synopsis: William Holden stars as Lt. Cmdr. Ken White, a Navy officer haunted by his order to submerge the U.S.S.&NFi; Tiger Shark&NFi_; during a World War II battle in the Pacific -- a decision that cost two fellow crewmembers their lives. Given command of the same vessel at the beginning of the Korean War, will the tormented White blow his one chance for redemption? William Bendix plays Holden's rancorous antagonist.
link.title: synopsis
Mission of the Shark: The Saga of the U.S.S. Indianapolis

link.synopsis: When her doctor delivers the bad news that she has only six months to live, hard-working widow Evelyn (Betty White) throws caution to the wind and journeys to Mexico, where she sparks a lively romance with debonair widower Lloyd (Leslie Nielsen). But then her doctor changes her prognosis, and the newly liberated Evelyn finds herself reverting to her old conventional ways. Jonathan Sanger directs this warmhearted made-for-television comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Home Is Where the Hart Is
Patty Duke Show: Still Rockin' in Brooklyn Heights
Love and Other Four Letter Words

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy from director Peter Hedges, advice columnist and widowed father of three Dan Burns meets a new woman who's beautiful and smart -- but she also happens to be the girlfriend of Dan's brother, Mitch.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: A small-time criminal concocts a big-time heist -- and inadvertently the crime of the century -- in this spirited comedy based on the infamous Brink's robbery in Boston, which netted the crew of amateur crooks nearly $3 million.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
Across the Line: The Exodus of Charlie Wright

link.synopsis: Tara Ricotto (Jennifer Tilly) has a diverse group of friends -- gay, straight, bisexual -- and they're all working on coming to terms with one another and their issues. Love, sex, health and childbirth are among the topics the group discusses lightheartedly. That is, until one gay couple is attacked. Responses to the attack vary within the circle of friends as the comedy gives way to seriousness and Tara does her best to nurture all.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This outlandish comedy chronicles the glorious efforts of despotic General Aladeen, dictator of the Republic of Wadiya, to oppress his people and fight democracy. Helping the tyrant maintain his rule at all costs is an all-female security force.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star

link.synopsis: An entertaining romantic comedy involving opposites: a spoiled and wealthy dilettante from South Korea and a North Korean girl who is the straight-laced daughter of an important government official. They meet in Yanbian, China to participate in a excavation there of ancient Korean treasures. Can they overcome their political and personal differences to realize their impossible love?
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Seoul
Woman Is the Future of Man
Once Upon a Time in Corea

link.synopsis: Two unemployed actors -- Withnail (Richard E. Grant) and Marwood (Paul McGann) -- take a trip to the British countryside in 1969. But instead of rejuvenation, they experience a lack of food, an abundance of rain and a plethora of alcohol. Their host, Withnail's gay Uncle Monty (Richard Griffiths), displays a love for life and a lust for Marwood. This classic art-house comedy won an Evening Standard British Film Award.
link.title: synopsis
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
Ladies and Gentlemen, The Fabulous Stains
A Film with Me in It
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: Blending the comedy stylings of Bill Cosby, Steve Martin and Paul Reiser, funnyman Kenn Kington serves up an offbeat take on the craziness life dishes out. Whatever your taste in humor, you'll bust a gut watching one of the club circuit's hottest comics; this performance was filmed at the Ultimate Comedy Night in Houston. The show also includes the musical comedy of Paul Aldrich and Mike Williams' prop shtick.
link.title: synopsis
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Bob & Tom Radio: The Comedy Tour
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice

link.synopsis: Freaked out that they're nearing "the Big 3-0," a group of grad student friends try to find true love in this romantic comedy. Amy (Carla Gugino) secretly waits for best friend Danny (Matt Letscher) to end things with Zoey (Saffron Burrows) so she can swoop in for the kill. Meanwhile, Molly (Sherilyn Fenn) lives with doting writing instructor Alan (Jon Tenney) but would prefer a long-term lesson in love from an older professor (Bruce Davison).
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Directors Joshua Zeman and Barbara Brancaccio explore an urban legend that always disturbed them while growing up in Staten Island, N.Y. -- a rash of child abductions that struck the area in the 1970s and 80s -- in their gripping documentary. The legend became real when a handyman and drifter named Andre Rand abducted numerous young kids, setting off myriad motive theories, frightening residents in the community and tripping up the legal system.
link.title: synopsis
Aileen: Life and Death of a Serial Killer
James Ellroy's LA: City of Demons
Dear Zachary: A Letter to a Son About His Father
H.H. Holmes: America's First Serial Killer
The Power of Forgiveness: The Story of Karla Faye Tucker
Mr. Death: The Rise and Fall of Fred A. Leuchter Jr.
Aileen Wuornos: The Selling of a Serial Killer
The Man Who Would Be Polka King
Trained in the Ways of Men
Frontline: The Dancing Boys of Afghanistan

link.synopsis: Already dealing with his parents' divorce, sad-sack Danny Stein (Steven Kaplan) faces his next big emotional challenge: asking a girl to prom and getting her into a hotel room after the dance -- something even total dweeb Bart Beeber is confidently planning. But as Danny's prospects dwindle, he turns to ever-more desperate measures to score the perfect date. Brian Hecker directs this teen comedy that co-stars William H. Macy and Alia Shawkat.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After his TV star girlfriend, Sarah Marshall (Kristen Bell), breaks his heart, Peter (Jason Segel) wants nothing more than to enjoy his vacation in Hawaii. But there are two big problems: No. 1, Sarah's vacationing at the same resort; No. 2, she's bringing her new beau. Mila Kunis, Paul Rudd and Bill Hader also star in this madcap relationship comedy from hit producer Judd Apatow (Knocked Up, Superbad).
link.title: synopsis
Russell Brand in New York City
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
The Night of the White Pants
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Comedy godfather Jonathan Winters stars as himself in this riotous spoof of his obsession with being a serious painter. Plenty of Winters's famous friends try to help -- but the theft of his favorite painting threatens to derail his ambitions.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
4192: The Crowning of the Hit King
Special When Lit: A Pinball Documentary
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talkin' About Him?)
George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing
Harlan Ellison: Dreams with Sharp Teeth
Terry Fator: Live from Las Vegas

link.synopsis: Suave Saigon playboy Khang (Binh Minh) and his earnest entrepreneurial sidekick, Hieu (Huy Khanh), pursue coveted university degrees in America, where Khang quickly falls for a single-mom cop and the engaged Hieu falls for a Vietnamese-American beauty queen (Ngoc Diep). As family drama surfaces on two continents, Khang and Hieu soon realize that love is a tricky concept in any language in this charming romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Woman Is the Future of Man
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: Brother-sister dance duo Tom and Ellen Bowen (Fred Astaire and Jane Powell) get the chance of a lifetime when they're booked for a London performance on the eve of Elizabeth II's nuptials. In the course of their journey, Ellen meets her match in Lord Brindale, and Tom finds romance with a British hoofer. Will love break up the act? Peter Lawford and Sarah Churchill also star in this classic 1950s musical comedy.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: In this horror-comedy hybrid, a chemical spill at a weapons lab leads to a zombie outbreak. This spells big trouble for the employees trapped inside the facility after an emergency lockdown is declared to try to contain the menace.
link.title: synopsis
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition
Bachelor Party in the Bungalow of the Damned
Death Valley: The Revenge of Bloody Bill
Blood Feast 2: All U Can Eat
Masters of Horror: Joe Dante: Homecoming
From Dusk Till Dawn 3: The Hangman's Daughter

link.synopsis: The funeral for the patriarch of a wealthy but eccentric British clan is turned topsy-turvy when a stranger appears, claiming to be the dead man's gay lover, in this black comedy from director Frank Oz. The dysfunctional family grows wackier as the deceased's sons decide they can't let the rest of the guests get wind of this revelation. But can they get the cat back into the bag? Peter Dinklage, Matthew Macfadyen and Rupert Graves co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: This lighthearted comedy follows Michael, Albert, Stanley and Sefa, four thirtysomething friends who refuse to grow up. Notorious for crashing weddings, they've all been banned from Michael's little brother's wedding unless they straighten up and bring respectable dates -- which is easier said than done. With this coming-of-age story, director Chris Graham reveals a side of New Zealand's Polynesian culture that is rarely seen.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Jerry (Rock Hudson) is an advertising executive who's gleaned success through his smarmy actions. His rival Carol (Doris Day) can't stand Jerry's immoral tactics and tells the Ad Council. In response, Jerry sends a stunning female employee (Edie Adams) to appeal to the all-male council and puts her in fake commercials for a non-existent product. When the spots accidentally air, Jerry must scramble to create the product -- if Carol doesn't first.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: By the Light of the Silvery Moon
I'll See You in My Dreams
Jayne Mansfield Collection: Will Success Spoil Rock Hunter?
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

link.synopsis: Sam Baker's (Molly Ringwald) 16th birthday should be perfect and memorable, but her whole family is so preoccupied with her older sister's (Blanche Baker) wedding that they completely forget her big day. But catching the eye of Jake Ryan (Michael Schoeffling) would make everything better for Sam. Anthony Michael Hall, John Cusack, Gedde Watanabe and Haviland Morris co-star in writer-director John Hughes's classic 1980s teen-angst comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
My Best Friend Is a Vampire

link.synopsis: After witnessing a murder, high-powered -- and estranged -- wife Meryl (Sarah Jessica Parker) and husband Paul (Hugh Grant) Morgan must say good-bye to sophisticated Manhattan when they enter the witness protection program together and land in Wyoming. At odds, they attempt to adjust to small-town life in this charming comedy that also stars Sam Elliott, Mary Steenburgen and Elisabeth Moss. Marc Lawrence (Two Weeks Notice) writes and directs.
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
I Don't Know How She Does It
Sex and the City: The Movie

title.regular: Did You Hear About the Morgans?
title.short: Did You Hear About the Morgans?

link.synopsis: Jason Segel and Emily Blunt star in this contemporary romantic comedy as an engaged young couple who discovers that the more they get to know each other, the more unpredictable their commitment to getting married becomes.
link.title: synopsis
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
The Men Who Stare at Goats

link.synopsis: Director Franois Ozon spins a deft social comedy of the French bourgeoisie starring some of that country's most celebrated actors, including Grard Depardieu, Catherine Deneuve and Fabrice Luchini. After Suzanne Pujol's (Deneuve) husband has a heart attack, she must take charge of the umbrella factory he manages. The resulting clashes between the genteel Suzanne and the Marxist union boss (Depardieu) generate plenty of riotous class conflict.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: When Athena (Angela Vint) and Lilith (Megan Fahlenbock) decide to have a baby, they don't want just any baby: They want a baby that comes from both of them. But how to do it without a man? An experimental procedure that can turn stem cells into semen, of course. With this inventive independent comedy, director Alison Reid explores the limits of scientific possibility alongside the quirks of unconventional parenthood.
link.title: synopsis
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement

link.synopsis: A total outcast at her private school, Esther (Danielle Catanzariti) suffocates under her mother's (Essie Davis) constant pressure at home. But after forming an unlikely friendship with well-liked Sunni (Keisha Castle-Hughes), Esther starts taking daring risks and suddenly becomes popular. A smart, good-natured comedy about learning to be yourself, this Australian coming-of-age story also features Toni Collette.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, I Love You Not

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the comedy Trouble with Angels, Mother Superior still presides over the St. Francis Academy Catholic boarding school for girls. On a field trip to California, the differences between the nuns and the students rise to the surface.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Patty Duke Show: Still Rockin' in Brooklyn Heights

link.synopsis: An all-star comedy team headlines this zany 1967 farce, starring Bob Hope as widower Henry Dimsdale, a bank teller who goes on the run with his seven kids after he's suspected of embezzlement. Phyllis Diller co-stars as their faithful housekeeper and baby sitter, Golda, who must keep her dim-witted cop boyfriend (Jonathan Winters) at bay in order to protect the fugitive family. Past and future Bond girls Shirley Eaton and Jill St. John co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Last Time I Saw Archie
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: Spartacus is an unwilling gladiator, a captive of Rome -- but he's not alone. Each gladiator must kill to live, and then write his legend in the spray of his rivals' blood. But how did these men earn their brutal reputations?
link.title: synopsis
Spartacus: Blood and Sand - Motion Comic
National Geographic: Beyond the Movie: Alexander the Great
WWE: Greatest Superstars of the 21st Century

link.synopsis: In this remake of the award-winning European romantic comedy Mostly Martha, Catherine Zeta-Jones plays Kate, an emotionally fragile chef whose life is turned upside down when she becomes her niece's (Abigail Breslin) sole guardian. Kate is used to absolute control -- both in her kitchen and at home. But now she faces chaos on all fronts, as both the child and her new sous chef (Aaron Eckhart) work their way into her heart.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: When the curator of the Louvre is found murdered in the famed museum's hallowed halls, Harvard professor Robert Langdon (Tom Hanks) and cryptographer Sophie Neve (Audrey Tautou) must untangle a deadly web of deceit involving the works of Leonardo da Vinci. Ian McKellen, Jean Reno, Paul Bettany and Alfred Molina co-star in this this gripping thriller from director Ron Howard, based on the best-selling novel by Dan Brown.
link.title: synopsis
Unlocking Da Vinci's Code: Mystery or Conspiracy?
Origins of the Da Vinci Code

link.synopsis: Winner of six Academy Awards, including Best Picture, director Robert Zemeckis's charming blend of comedy and drama stars Tom Hanks as Forrest Gump, a simpleminded man who finds himself in the middle of nearly every major event of the 1960s and '70s. Along the way, he makes friends, changes lives and searches for a soul mate. Hanks nabbed a Best Actor Oscar for his remarkable portrayal of the unsophisticated yet surprisingly wise Forrest.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama)

link.title: How to Make an American Quilt

link.synopsis: Filmmaker Doug Pray explores the fascinating and mysterious world of advertising in this compelling documentary, which includes interviews with the talented minds that created famous taglines such as "Where's the Beef?" and "Just Do It."
link.title: synopsis
Milton Glaser: To Inform and Delight
The Killing of a Chinese Cookie
Page One: Inside the New York Times
Art 21: Art in the Twenty-First Century
Visual Acoustics: The Modernism of Julius Shulman
A Lawyer Walks into a Bar...
The Future We Will Create: Inside the World of TED
Picasso and Braque Go to the Movies

link.synopsis: Taking his geeky prep school roommate, Jonathan Ogner (Andrew McCarthy), under his worldly wing, Skip Burroughs (Rob Lowe) packs him off to lose his virginity in Chicago -- where Jonathan unwittingly embarks on a torrid affair with Skip's mother (Jacqueline Bisset). But after learning that Jonathan isn't who he claims to be, she ends the liaison ... until Skip brings Jonathan home for Christmas. John Cusack co-stars in this rite-of-passage comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Ali G (Sacha Baron Cohen), the white gangsta-rapper wannabe from the UK, makes his big-screen debut in this wacky comedy -- and this time around, he's taking a stand against the demolition of his beloved John Nike Leisure Centre. But it doesn't take long for Ali G to get elected to government and become unwittingly embroiled in a political scandal led by Deputy Prime Minister David Carlton (Charles Dance), who plots to unseat the current PM.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Rock
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Christopher Walken
Katt Williams: American Hustle: The Movie
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Farley
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Adam Sandler

link.synopsis: Christopher Meloni co-directs and stars in this crude comedy about sleazy producer Charlie (Meloni), whose goal is to up the ante in comedy filmmaking by creating a movie out of the most offensive and outrageous jokes of all time. But there's a lot of work for Charlie and his company's CEO (Robert Klein) to do as they assemble their cast and work on their script -- like finding the perfect dirty jokes to shock even the most depraved viewers.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star

link.synopsis: Movie-making brothers Joel and Ethan Coen helm this battle-of-the-sexes comedy centered on respected attorney Miles Massey (George Clooney) and his toe-to-toe battle with his wealthy client's ex-wife, skilled gold-digger Marylin Rexroth (Catherine Zeta-Jones). Just when Marylin thinks she's cinched another fortune, she's defeated by the "Massey pre-nup" and schemes to get even. Geoffrey Rush, Cedric the Entertainer and Billy Bob Thornton co-star.
link.title: synopsis
He's Just Not That Into You
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee

link.synopsis: When his doctor informs him he'll die soon from an unnamed disease, self-proclaimed artist K. Roth Binew (Mike O'Connell) -- who's never completed a work of art -- decides to celebrate his life with a party in this absurdist black comedy. As poet and biographer Mills Joquin (Jesse Eisenberg) drives him around in a bicycle-powered rickshaw, Binew delivers invitations for the wake that will occur that evening.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
A Film with Me in It
Me and You and Everyone We Know
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Using the bold, bright colors of a graphic novel, this animated romantic comedy follows three astronauts as they race against a robot-manned spaceship to become the first crew to land on Mars. Along the way, they endure boredom, stress and love. As Charlie (Mark Duplass), Casey (Zoe Simpson) and Hank (Paul Gordon) travel ever closer to the Red Planet, the nature of exploration -- and why we are so drawn to the heavens -- is compellingly examined.
link.title: synopsis
Into the Universe with Stephen Hawking
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
Can We Make it to Mars?: Nova scienceNOW
The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
Moribito: Guardian of the Sacred Spirit
Phoenix Mars Mission: Onto the Ice
Dark Star: Hyperdrive Edition: Theatrical Cut
Dark Star: Hyperdrive Edition: Director's Cut

link.synopsis: Although he hates the way his life has turned out, would-be writer Xavier (Romain Duris) has no one to blame but himself. So when an opportunity comes along that could change his luck, he knows he'd better not blow it. Audrey Tautou, Kelly Reilly, Cecile De France, Kevin Bishop, Evguenya Obraztsova, Irene Montale and Gary Love round out the ensemble cast in Cedric Klapisch's sequel to his romantic comedy L'Auberge Espagnole.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?
Etoiles: Dancers of the Paris Opera Ballet

link.synopsis: The Monty Python comedy clan skewers King Arthur and his knights of the round table as they quest far and wide for the Holy Grail in this inspired piece of lunacy that's utterly quotable -- particularly the bit involving knights who say "Ni." John Cleese stands out as the Black Knight, who suffers gory, slow dismemberment at the hands of the mighty king himself yet maintains that "It's just a scratch" after every whack.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Graham Chapman's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Michael Palin's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Terry Gilliam's Personal Best
The Man Who Would Be King
The Man with the Golden Gun

title.regular: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
title.short: Monty Python and the Holy Grail

link.synopsis: After his boyfriend dumps him, handsome Drake (David Rudd) takes out his pain on a close-knit group of gay men by leading each man down a different path of temptation, starting with the group's sole couple Bobby (Alexis Suarez) and Sean (Bryan West). Featuring a cast of stage stars that includes Desmond Dutcher and Mark Ford, director Richard LeMay's comedy-drama makes for a sexy portrait of gay relationships in the Big Apple.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2

link.synopsis: Neurotic prep school English teacher Jake Singer (Chris Eigeman) seeks therapy after he gets dumped. Along the way, he meets and woos a gorgeous and wealthy widow (Famke Janssen) while his shrink (Ian Holm) -- who may or may not be real -- badgers him with Freudian mind games. Director Oren Rudavsky's smart romantic comedy, based on a novel by Daniel Menaker, won the Best New York Award at the Tribeca Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Stunning animation and on-location photography highlight this documentary that chronicles the fascinating history of NASA's Deep Impact probe, designed to collide with a comet on a kamikaze data-gathering mission. Go behind the scenes of the 2005 mission as NASA scientists and engineers design the spacecraft and eventually fire it off into space at a blazing 23,000 mph, on a precision-collision course with the comet Tempel 1.
link.title: synopsis
Voyage to the Planets and Beyond
Invisible Empire: A New World Order Defined
Prehistoric America: A Journey Through the Ice Age and Beyond
Out of the Wild: The Alaska Experiment
Physics: The Elegant Universe and Beyond
Three Gorges: Biggest Dam in the World
World's Biggest Airliner: The Airbus A380: The Race to Build
Secrets of the Dead: Killer Flu
Before We Ruled the Earth: Hunt or Be Hunted
Wolves: A Legend Returns to Yellowstone
A Wayfarer's Journey: Listening to Mahler
Global Warming: What's Up with the Weather?

link.synopsis: After achieving great success and notoriety in Europe, race car champ Betty Blake (Virginia Vale) returns home to the United States to continue her winning streak. But she's given a cool reception from fellow driver Jim Flynn (Robert Kent), who's determined to beat her. It's only a matter of time before rivalry leads to romance. This auto-racing melodrama features a cameo from real-life racer Barney Oldfield, who plays himself.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Affairs of Bel Ami
The Luck of the Irish / I'll Never Forget You

link.synopsis: The apocalypse is now in this searing hypothetical portrait of a planet besieged by natural cataclysms -- and the efforts of humans to survive under such conditions. In this cold new world, where fires burn and tsunamis roil, humanity is forced to reckon with the same devastation that -- according to many scientists -- may have wiped out the dinosaurs. Step into this sobering but ultimately uplifting account of human survival.
link.title: synopsis
World Almanac Video: The Expanding Universe
Life on Mars / Peru's Mystery in Stone
Earth Report: State of the Planet 2009
Journey to the Edge of the Universe
Out of the Wild: The Alaska Experiment
Secrets of the Dead: Killer Flu
Phoenix Mars Mission: Ashes to Ice
Physics: The Elegant Universe and Beyond
National Geographic: The Human Family Tree
Into the Universe with Stephen Hawking
National Geographic: The Incredible Human Body
National Geographic: Egypt Eternal: The Quest for Lost Tombs
National Geographic: Nefertiti and the Lost Dynasty
Fractals: Hunting the Hidden Dimension: Nova

link.synopsis: Tired of being a perpetual bridesmaid after helping 27 friends tie the knot, altruistic Jane (Katherine Heigl) finds herself facing her worst nightmare as her younger sister (Malin Akerman) announces her engagement to the man Jane secretly adores. But when Jane meets the charming Kevin (James Marsden), will she beat her sibling to the altar? Edward Burns and Judy Greer also star in this breezy romantic comedy from director Anne Fletcher.
link.title: synopsis
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: In this underrated (and fairly violent) black comedy, gullible Guy (Frank Whaley) lands a job as personal assistant to Buddy Ackerman (Kevin Spacey), a repulsive, cutthroat studio exec who turns Guy's daily routine into a pride-swallowing siege. Guy is eager to climb the ladder of success, but Buddy stops at nothing to grab credit and foil Guy's plans. What Buddy doesn't know is that the tables are about to turn.
link.title: synopsis
The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou

link.synopsis: When penniless klutz Norman Phiffier (Jerry Lewis) falls in love with department-store heiress Barbara Tuttle (Jill St. John), the girl's snooty mother (Agnes Moorehead) tries to derail the romance by giving him ridiculous and demeaning tasks around the store. Hilarity ensues as Norman proves he's the right man for the girl, even as he leaves a path of retail wreckage in his wake. Ray Walston co-stars in this comedy from director Frank Tashlin.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
The Last Time I Saw Archie
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

link.synopsis: Unable to afford the European vacation he'd dreamed of, recent college grad James Brennan (Jesse Eisenberg) reluctantly takes a gig at a local amusement park, only to learn that the dead-end job is, in fact, excellent preparation for the real world. Writer-director Greg Mottola's semi-autobiographical comedy-drama, filmed in Pittsburgh's Kennywood Park, also stars Ryan Reynolds and Kristen Stewart.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard

link.synopsis: In this cosmopolitan comedy, love triangles and romantic entanglements give the word &NFi;complications&NFi_; new meaning. Jennifer Aniston portrays Nina Borowski, a straight woman who asks gay George Hanson (Paul Rudd) to move in with her only hours after the two meet. As their bond grows, she discovers she's expecting and wants George to be the child's surrogate father ... to the dismay of Nina's loutish, arrogant ex-beau (John Pankow).
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Shortly after David Abbott (Mark Ruffalo) moves into his new San Francisco digs, he has an unwelcome visitor on his hands: winsome Elizabeth Martinson (Reese Witherspoon), who asserts that the apartment is hers -- and promptly vanishes. When she starts appearing and disappearing at will, David thinks she's a ghost, while Elizabeth is convinced she's alive. Their quest for the truth ultimately leads to love in this spectral romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
The Giallo Collection: Short Night of Glass Dolls
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: Forest Whitaker and funnyman Carlos Mencia butt heads as two domineering dads forced to set aside their culture-clash differences and team up to plan their children's wedding, with only two weeks until the big day arrives. America Ferrera plays the pregnant bride-to-be opposite Lance Gross as her medical resident fiancé in this wacky comedy from writer-director Rick Famuyiwa (Brown Sugar, The Wood).
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family

link.synopsis: Determined to improve the romantic prospects of her lonely single mother, Kin Ho, quirky but well-meaning 12-year-old Mindy (Valerie Tian) resorts to Taoist magic to do the trick. But although the spells and potions seem to miss the mark, Kin finds her humdrum, unfulfilling life given a fresh spark from her daughter's good-intentioned charms. Reteaming with director Mina Shum (Double Happiness), Sandra Oh stars in this enchanting light comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers
In the Time of the Butterflies

link.synopsis: In this Rob Reiner comedy, Sarah Huttinger (Jennifer Aniston) travels to California for her sister's wedding, where her grandmother (Shirley MacLaine) reveals a bit of gossip: Sarah's mother cheated on her father just a few days before they were married. The plot thickens when Sarah hears a rumor about a local family who served as the real-life inspiration for The Graduate's Robinson clan. Mark Ruffalo, Kevin Costner and Mena Suvari co-star.
link.title: synopsis
I Could Never Be Your Woman
He's Just Not That Into You
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: While visiting friends in London, American journalism student Jade Spence (Scarlett Johansson) beats out Britain's top reporters by exposing a story involving murder and magic. But just as the story heats up, so do things between Jade and a hunky aristocrat (Hugh Jackman). Ian McShane co-stars in this Woody Allen comedy that casts Allen as a quirky magician who calls himself "The Great Splendini."
link.title: synopsis
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me
Dark Portals: The Chronicles of Vidocq

link.synopsis: Based on Clarence Day Jr.'s memoirs about growing up with his semi-tyrannical father, this wonderful comedy is truly one of the classics. William Powell stars as Father, a Wall Street broker who likes to think he rules the roost. But when a small crisis over his religious upbringing causes havoc, it becomes clear that it's really his adoring wife (Irene Dunne) and their enterprising children who pull the strings.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Time I Saw Paris
Anna and the King of Siam
I Was a Male War Bride
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: When housekeeper Grace Hawkins (Maggie Smith) arrives at the Goodfellow vicarage, she finds a reverend (Rowan Atkinson) too busy for sex, a bored wife (Kristin Scott Thomas) who's bedding her golf instructor (Patrick Swayze), a promiscuous teenage daughter and a bullied son. Little does the family know that their new "Mary Poppins" has a few tricks -- and secrets -- up her treacherous sleeve. Niall Johnson directs this wickedly black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Down and Out in Beverly Hills

link.synopsis: Writer-director Todd Sklar casts himself as a college student alongside his three best friends (Alex Rennie, Nick Renkoski and Chad Haas) as they make their way through their final year at school, where every day offers a new chance to do pretty much whatever they want. The ensuing comedy is as much a tribute to Sklar's real-life college days as it is a tongue-in-cheek portrait of an emerging generation.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Gonzo: The Life and Work of Dr. Hunter S. Thompson

link.synopsis: Director Elem Klimov's drama shows the atrocities of World War II through Soviet eyes. When 13-year-old commoner Florya joins a group of partisans fighting the Nazis in Belorus, he doesn't suspect that he is plunging through the looking glass. Separated from his comrades during a paratroop attack and struck deaf by artillery, Florya wanders a battle-scorched Russian purgatory of forests and man-made slaughter.
link.title: synopsis
Agony: The Life and Death of Rasputin
The Big Red One: Special Edition
A Year of the Quiet Sun

link.synopsis: Set in suburban London, this International Emmy-winning comedy centers on life inside Sanjeev Kumar's in-house television studio, a "salon of satire" where he interviews celebrities and shares airtime with his eccentric but supportive family.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life
Terry Jones: The Hidden History of Rome

link.synopsis: This fun family comedy tells the story of Hercules (Richard Sandrak), known as "Little Herc," who, at the age of 12, decides to live life as a normal boy, not a god. Disobeying his father, Zeus (Hulk Hogan), Herc sneaks off Olympus to Burbank, Calif., where the adventures begin! His new friend Curtis (Marc John Jefferies) helps him navigate the strange new world of junior high and bullies, but when danger threatens his family, Herc must save Olympus.
link.title: synopsis
The Mystical Adventures of Billy Owens
Sarah Landon and the Paranormal Hour
Jim Henson's the Storyteller: Greek Myths
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird

link.synopsis: When the otherwise happy and successful Ricardo develops a case of erectile dysfunction, it creates a crisis in his marriage to Blanca. The couple soon embarks on various schemes to rescue Ricardo's vitality in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as Emma and Liv, best friends who become worst enemies when they realize their respective weddings are scheduled on the same day at their dream venue -- the Plaza Hotel. It's no holds barred as these two bridezillas go on a ruthless rampage toward matrimony. The romantic comedy also stars Candice Bergen (as the wedding planner), Bryan Greenberg, Kristen Johnston and Chris Pratt.
link.title: synopsis
He's Just Not That Into You

link.synopsis: The chances that groom-to-be Elvis (Kenneth Nkosi) will make it to his wedding on time dwindle with each passing hour as he and best man Tumi (Rapulana Seiphemo) experience car trouble, meet up with a strange British hitchhiker and run into other obstacles en route to Cape Town. Meanwhile, Elvis's lovely fiance, Ayanda (Zandile Msutwana), faces a crisis of her own. Jodie Whittaker co-stars in this comedy from South Africa, directed by Jann Turner.
link.title: synopsis
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Five on the Black Hand Side

link.synopsis: Two professional couples deal with marital boredom and infidelity in this Bollywood comedy. Banker Samit (Irrfan Khan) and his cosmetic surgeon wife, Mita (Soha Ali Khan), face the repercussions of Samit's affair with his aerobics instructor (Payal Rohatgi). Meanwhile, professor/documentary filmmaker Rishi (Rahul Bose) lusts after a student (Saba), while his advice columnist wife, Simi (Konkona Sen Sharma), falls for a colleague (Rahul Khanna).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Based on a true story, this outlandish comedy stars John Malkovich as Alan Conway, a second-rate con man who successfully passed himself off as legendary director Stanley Kubrick in the late 1990s. Kubrick, a known recluse, was a perfect target for Conway, who used his persona to find fame and fortune. Directed by Brian W. Cook, this verité-style indie satirizes the allure of celebrity in the modern age.
link.title: synopsis
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride

link.synopsis: Part social commentary, part outrageous fantasy, Terry Gilliam's black comedy set in an Orwellian future stars Jonathan Pryce as a daydreaming civil servant who, through one bureaucratic error after another, is mistaken for an enemy of the state. By turns grimly disturbing and darkly hilarious, the wildly inventive, visually arresting Oscar-nominated satire co-stars Katherine Helmond and Robert De Niro as a renegade repairman.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Fell to Earth
Blade Runner: Theatrical and Director's Cut

link.synopsis: This delightful comedy stars Dick Van Dyke as Fitzwilly, a good-hearted butler who organizes a petty crime ring to keep his daffy employer, Victoria Woodhouse (Edith Evans), from discovering that despite her propensity for philanthropy, she's dead broke. Aided by fellow servants, Fitzwilly concocts an ingenious scheme to rob Gimbel's and finance Miss Vickie's charities, but his larceny may be detected by her secretary, Juliet (Barbara Feldon).
link.title: synopsis
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Patty Duke Show: Still Rockin' in Brooklyn Heights
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: Irish American Jimmy Kelly (Eddie Quillan) can't control his fierce temper, and after losing yet another job, he becomes a process server to prove he can provide for his sweet fiance, Margie (Joan Woodbury), in this fast-paced 1943 comedy from champion B-movie studio Monogram. With his best buddy in tow, Jimmy learns the ropes quickly, and his flying fists prove helpful -- especially when he has to serve gangster Trixie (Maxie Rosenbloom).
link.title: synopsis
Sherlock Holmes: The Woman in Green

link.synopsis: Mayson's (Dan Selon) romantic crusade to kiss a boy for the first time becomes the concern of all his friends, leading his best pal, Robyn (Kendra Thomas), to drag him to a Valentine's Day party, where they run into Reiley (Jared Welch). The tension instantly escalates in this romantic comedy as Reiley is the guy Mayson's had his eye on all along. But true love is far from a sure thing, especially where young and tentative lovers are concerned.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
The Best of Boys in Love
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: Socialite Tracy Lord (Katharine Hepburn) prepares to remarry, but her ex (Cary Grant) and a tabloid reporter (Best Supporting Actor Oscar-winner James Stewart) have other ideas as they converge on her home for a fateful visit. The three stars form an incomparable trio in one of the most tantalizing screwball romances ever. And under the direction of George Cukor, this once-urbane Broadway comedy springs to life with precision and wit.
link.title: synopsis
You Can't Take It with You
I Was a Male War Bride
Katharine Hepburn: On Her Own Terms
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Funnyman Kevin James stars as Paul Blart, an overzealous security guard who finds himself in over his head when he attempts to thwart a criminal mastermind's plot to rob an entire shopping mall in this family-friendly comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself

link.synopsis: Former hit man Paul Thorn has left his violent life behind, but his newfound peace is shattered when a dying ex-colleague passes him vital information. While trying to learn the truth and expose the man's killers, Paul must elude a rival assassin.
link.title: synopsis
The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada

link.synopsis: Aching to escape her dull duties as daughter of the U.S ambassador to France, Joan Fisk (Olivia de Havilland) sets out to demonstrate a point to her father and his small-minded friends in this genial comedy. Deeming all American servicemen wolves, a U.S. senator (Adolphe Menjou) wants to put Paris off limits to them. To prove him wrong, Joan begins a harmless fling with a young American soldier (John Forsythe) -- but ends up falling in love.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Last Time I Saw Paris
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: This sequel to Xiaogang Feng's romantic comedy 'If You Are the One' continues the courtship of wealthy Qin Fin and young and lovely Xiaoxiao. To test their bond, the pair steals off to a remote villa where they try on the mantel of wedded bliss.
link.title: synopsis
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman
Legend of the Fist: The Return of Chen Zhen
How Much Do You Love Me?

title.regular: If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
title.short: If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: After fishing out coins from a water fountain in Italy, cynical New Yorker Beth Harper (Kristen Bell) finds herself being wooed by several ardent suitors. As she deals with the attention, Beth tries to figure out whether a charming reporter  (Josh Duhamel) really loves her. Danny DeVito, Anjelica Huston, Jon Heder, Dax Shepard and Will Arnett also star in this romantic comedy. Mark Steven Johnson directs.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: For as long as 16-year-old farmhand Ben Mockridge (Gary Grimes) can remember, he's wanted to be a cowboy -- and now, thanks to tough-talking trail boss Frank Culpepper (Billy Green Bush), he finally has a chance to prove himself. But as Ben puts his skills to the test on a bona fide cattle drive, he learns that life on the lonely prairie is more complicated than he ever imagined. Dick Richards directs in his feature-film debut.
link.title: synopsis
Shoot First and Pray You Live

link.synopsis: The next installment of this Hebrew-language sex-comedy series finds protagonists Bentzi (Yftach Katzur), Yudale (Zachi Noy) and Momo (Jonathan Sagall) sowing their wild oats in the 1960s as high school seniors, and Momo and Yudale scoring with the same hot girl: Bentzi's cousin (Sibylle Rauch). Meanwhile, Bentzi's trying his best to convince his girlfriend (Ariella Rabinovich) that they should go all the way.
link.title: synopsis
How Tasty Was My Little Frenchman
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington

link.synopsis: After hanging out with some hedonistic acquaintances, best pals Andrew (Joshua Leonard) and Ben (Mark Duplass) find their friendship tested in strange new ways when a dare leads them to contemplate filming a live sex scene together for an amateur porn festival. As the shoot date looms, our heroes must contend with two major logistical difficulties: Ben's wife, Anna (Alycia Delmore); and their heterosexuality. The indie comedy screened at the Sundance Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2
The Best of Boys in Love
Eating Out: All You Can Eat

link.synopsis: Considered a classic of late-1960s Euro sex comedies, The Libertine stars European sex kitten Catherine Spaak and French superstar Jean-Louis Trintignant. A young woman named Mimi discovers that her recently deceased husband had kept a secret apartment equipped to satisfy his unusual sexual desires. Initially upset that he had turned to others instead of her, Mimi soon decides to use the apartment to explore her own sexuality!
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon

link.synopsis: While attending one of India's premier colleges, miserable engineering students and best friends Rancho (Aamir Khan), Farhan (Madhavan) and Raju (Sharman Joshi) struggle to beat their school's draconian system, which, in their eyes, unfairly values grades over creativity. Loosely based on Chetan Bhagat's best-selling novel &NFi;Five Point Someone&NFi_;, this entertaining Bollywood comedy also stars Kareena Kapoor and Boman Irani.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come
